=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/06/12 Average Rating: 4.9 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Graeme Harper', 'Euros Lyn', 'Jamie Magnus Stone', 'Douglas Mackinnon', 'Rachel Talalay', 'James Strong', 'Charlie Palmer', 'James Hawes', 'Joe Ahearne', 'Toby Haynes'], 'Starring': ['David Tennant', 'Freema Agyeman', 'John Barrowman'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} Review Text: As I have continued to (re) watch each of these seasons of the "new" Doctor Who series.. I must say that I have been enjoying myself immensely!

Season three is another Great season in my opinion. And even though I believe that I have probably seen all of the episodes in this particular season some time ago.. I am still enjoying re-visiting each one of them and refreshing my memory!

The entire series has been terrific thus far. Review Title: Great Series, and Great Fun!.. Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Coming Home VHS Jane Fonda (Actor), Jon Voight (Actor), Hal Ashby (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: VHS Tape Movies & TV, Studio Specials, MGM Home Entertainment, All MGM Titles ['Amazon.com', "Both Jane Fonda and Jon Voight won Oscars for their performances in this profoundly moving 1978 flick dealing with the aftereffects of the Vietnam War. Fonda, feeling isolated while her hawkish husband, Bruce Dern, is away in Vietnam, follows a friend's example and volunteers at a veteran's hospital. There she is reacquainted with Voight, an old friend who has returned from the war as a paraplegic. Lonely and disconnected from her husband, Fonda finds love, and fulfilling sex, with Voight. The sex scenes, very steamy for the time, are still provocative. This mature love story is about expanding your horizons, and is both moving and thoughtful. Director Hal Ashby (", 'Harold and Maude', ') does succumb to melodrama on occasion, but these are forgivable slips.', "--Rochelle O'Gorman"] {'Package Dimensions': '7.32 x 4.19 x 1.12 inches; 6.13 Ounces', 'Director': 'Hal Ashby', 'Run time': '2 hours and 7 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 8, 1997', 'Date First Available': 'September 29, 2006', 'Actors': 'Jane Fonda, Jon Voight, Bruce Dern, Penelope Milford, Robert Carradine', 'Studio': 'MGM (Video & DVD)', 'Producers': 'Bruce Gilbert, Jerome Hellman', 'Writers': 'Nancy Dowd, Robert C. Jones, Rudy Wurlitzer, Waldo Salt'} I bought this VHS tape as a gift for a good friend of mine. She had owned a copy of it and was very happy to get another one! Very Nice! A Star Is Born VHS Barbra Streisand (Actor), Kris Kristofferson (Actor), Frank Pierson (Director, Writer) & 0 more Rated: R Format: VHS Tape Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama ['Product description', 'Guaranteed to work or your money back - PLEASE NOTE ALL MONIES FROM THIS SALE GO TO A 501 (C)3 NO KILL ANIMAL SHELTER', 'Amazon.com', 'This film actually began with the idea of remaking', 'A Star Is Born', 'with the then-hot couple James Taylor and Carly Simon. Eventually, it evolved into this vanity production for Barbra Streisand, with Kris Kristofferson as the designated stud muffin. The story remains the same: A superstar on the decline meets a young singer on the way up. They marry as their career trajectories intersect, and his eventual demise is meant as a sacrifice to further boost her career by ridding her of the burden of him. Kristofferson\'s rock & roll numbers are decidedly lousy--Hollywood\'s idea of rock music--and Streisand looks good and always sounds fine (she won an Oscar for cowriting the song "Evergreen"). But you can feel her heavy hand guiding every shot; she seems to serve as puppet master for director Frank Pierson, framing every image of herself for maximum glow. The ultimate date flick (if the guy can sit still through it).', '--Marshall Fine'] {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '7.32 x 4.19 x 1.12 inches; 6.08 Ounces', 'Director': 'Frank Pierson', 'Run time': '2 hours and 19 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 15, 1992', 'Date First Available': 'December 7, 2006', 'Actors': 'Barbra Streisand, Kris Kristofferson, Gary Busey, Oliver Clark, Venetta Fields', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Writers': 'Alvin Sargent, Frank Pierson, Jay Presson Allen, Joan Didion, John Gregory Dunne'} I purchased this VHS tape as a gift for a friend. She had owned a copy of it some time ago.. and was hoping to get another one! Very Nice! {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Takuya Igarashi', 'Yasuhiro Irie', 'Tensai Okamura', 'Takefumi Anzai', 'Shin Matsuo', 'Ikurô Satô', 'Daisuke Chiba', 'Shingo Kaneko', 'Yoshiyuki Asai', 'Toshinori Narita']} I just purchased a few of my Favorite Episodes of the Anime "Soul Eater" using Amazon Instant Video, and I want to say that I am very pleased! I have always enjoyed this animated series.. "Soul Eater" is a very funny and engaging show with very memorable characters.

It is nice to have a few of my most favorite episodes to watch when ever I want. The quality of the videos is, in my opinion, excellent! Very Nice Series! {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Takuya Igarashi', 'Yasuhiro Irie', 'Tensai Okamura', 'Takefumi Anzai', 'Shin Matsuo', 'Ikurô Satô', 'Daisuke Chiba', 'Shingo Kaneko', 'Yoshiyuki Asai', 'Toshinori Narita']} I just purchased a few of my Favorite Episodes of the Anime "Soul Eater" using Amazon Instant Video, and I want to say that I am very pleased! I have always enjoyed this animated series.. "Soul Eater" is a very funny and engaging show with very memorable characters.

It is nice to have a few of my most favorite episodes to watch when ever I want. The quality of the videos is, in my opinion, excellent! Especially the episodes that are available in HD.

The Series itself is nicely done, and follows a number of students in the DWMA (Death Weapon Meister Academy) as they learn to work with their partners and protect the world from evil. Excellent Animated Series {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Takuya Igarashi', 'Yasuhiro Irie', 'Tensai Okamura', 'Takefumi Anzai', 'Shin Matsuo', 'Ikurô Satô', 'Daisuke Chiba', 'Shingo Kaneko', 'Yoshiyuki Asai', 'Toshinori Narita']} I have been purchasing a few of my Favorite Episodes of the Anime "Soul Eater" using Amazon Instant Video, and I want to say that I am very pleased! I have always enjoyed this animated series.. "Soul Eater" is a very funny and engaging show with very memorable characters.

It is nice to have a few of my most favorite episodes to watch when ever I want. The quality of the videos is, in my opinion, excellent! Especially the episodes that are available in HD.

The Series itself is nicely done, and follows a number of students in the DWMA (Death Weapon Meister Academy) as they learn to work with their partners and protect the world from evil. Excellent (and Fun) Animated Series {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Manny Hernandez'], 'Producers': ['Daniel Chong', 'Brian A. Miller', 'Jennifer Pelphrey', 'Rob Sorcher', 'Carrie Wilksen', 'Randy Myers', 'Curtis Lelash', 'Diara Jaye', 'Tramm Wigzell'], 'Studio': ['Cartoon Network']} I decided to purchase a season pass for "We Bare Bears" (Season 1) after I had watched several episodes of this new series, and realized just how much I was enjoying each new "installment" as it came along.

In truth I am really beginning to love this show! It is very funny, well written, and the characters are very memorable. Griz, Panda, and Ice Bear have each continued to grow on me, the more I have seen them. And I can't wait to see where new storylines might go.

I also noticed that I was still enjoying re-watching each of the episodes, even though I had seen them many times. In my opinion, this series definitely has some real potential.. and it seems to possess a certain appeal!

EDITS: And, as many other folks here have said.. each episode seems to include a new song (which relates to the storyline) ..and these songs are also well done, they are rather catchy, and are quite memorable.. (just like what I had said about the characters, a few lines above in this review).

In one sense, it is too bad that these little "song sequences" tend to be a bit short.. but they work, and they are cool.

So.. in my opinion, "We Bare Bears" is very nicely done, ..a wonderful series thus far! Wonderful Series!! {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Graeme Harper', 'Euros Lyn', 'Jamie Magnus Stone', 'Douglas Mackinnon', 'Rachel Talalay', 'James Strong', 'Charlie Palmer', 'James Hawes', 'Joe Ahearne', 'Toby Haynes'], 'Starring': ['Christopher Eccleston', 'Billie Piper'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} I recently began watching this show ("Doctor Who Season 1") on Amazon Prime after having seen some of the episodes (but not all of them) before.

So.. I decided I should probably try starting the series over at the beginning.. and watching it through. And i am really glad that I did!

This show is totally awesome, and it is a whole lot of fun! It really recaptures a great deal of the feel from the original "Doctor Who" series that began back in the 60's. Great Series!! {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Graeme Harper', 'Euros Lyn', 'Jamie Magnus Stone', 'Douglas Mackinnon', 'Rachel Talalay', 'James Strong', 'Charlie Palmer', 'James Hawes', 'Joe Ahearne', 'Toby Haynes'], 'Starring': ['David Tennant', 'Billie Piper'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} I recently began (re) watching the "new" Doctor Who series from the beginning, ..after having seen many (but not all) of the episodes (basically up to the end of season 4) a few years back.

My goal is to get caught up on the series.. and I figured the best thing to do was start at the beginning and watch the all, to refresh my memory.

I am very glad that I did.. Season 2 of Doctor Who is really Great! ..and I am really enjoying revisiting the entire series thus far! Another Great Season.. {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Graeme Harper', 'Euros Lyn', 'Jamie Magnus Stone', 'Douglas Mackinnon', 'Rachel Talalay', 'James Strong', 'Charlie Palmer', 'James Hawes', 'Joe Ahearne', 'Toby Haynes'], 'Starring': ['David Tennant', 'Freema Agyeman', 'John Barrowman'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} As I have continued to (re) watch each of these seasons of the "new" Doctor Who series.. I must say that I have been enjoying myself immensely!

Season three is another Great season in my opinion. And even though I believe that I have probably seen all of the episodes in this particular season some time ago.. I am still enjoying re-visiting each one of them and refreshing my memory!

The entire series has been terrific thus far. Great Series, and Great Fun!..
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interest:** The user maintains a deep passion for classic films and is actively exploring modern animated series and adaptations. Their recent engagement with iconic series, particularly through revisiting beloved narratives like a popular science fiction show, reflects a commitment to experiencing stories that intertwine nostalgia with contemporary themes.

- **Media Format Preference:** The user shows a consistent preference for both vintage formats and digital platforms, highlighting their eagerness to engage with quality content across diverse eras. Their recent rewatching habit reinforces a dedication to understanding narratives from various angles, enhancing their appreciation for evolving storytelling.

- **Interpersonal Connection:** The user's enthusiasm for sharing unique cinematic experiences continues, as demonstrated by their enjoyment in discussing well-loved series with friends. Their focus on character-driven narratives suggests a desire to foster deep connections through shared viewing experiences.

- **Content Appreciation:** The user's discerning taste remains evident, with an emphasis on high-quality media that explores mature themes. Their enjoyment of depth and emotional resonance in storytelling drives their preferences and guides their selections.

- **Rating Tendencies:** The user consistently grants high ratings to content they engage with, reaffirming their refined taste and enthusiasm for standout releases. Their latest interactions underscore a continued delight in revisiting classic elements within narratives, solidifying their appreciation for series that engage anew while honoring tradition.

In summary, the user cherishes profound cinematic and animated experiences, enjoys nostalgic revisits, and seeks to build meaningful connections through engaging storytelling.
